meanings.definition: To make (something) less wild or difficult to control.
meanings.sent1: She was taming the wild horse with patience and care.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper spent weeks taming the new lion to behave around visitors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought it was taming the curtains during playtime.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice was like taming a stormy sea of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The trainer's gentle methods of taming the aggressive dog were truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The action or process of taming something.
meanings.sent1: The taming of the shrew was a popular theme in old stories.
meanings.sent2: His expertise in animal taming made him a sought-after performer in the circus.
meanings.sent3: The taming of the wild garden was a satisfying challenge for the young gardener.
meanings.sent4: The taming of the wind by the skilled sailor was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The gradual taming of the once fierce dragon brought peace to the kingdom.
